text: Eliphaz’s First Response to Job
Then\f + \fr 4:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
“\add If\add* someone would test a word with you, would you be offended?
But\f + \fr 4:2 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* who can refrain from speaking?
Look, you have instructed many,
and you have strengthened weak hands.
Your words have raised up \add the one who\add* stumbles,
and you have strengthened knees giving way.
But now it has come to you, and you are worn out;
it touches you, and you are horrified.
\add Is\add* not your fear \add in God\add* your confidence?
\add Is not\add* your hope even\f + \fr 4:6 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* the integrity of your ways?
“⸤Think⸥\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Literally “Remember” \f* now, who has perished \add who is\add* innocent?
Or\f + \fr 4:7 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* where \add are\add* the upright destroyed?
\add Just\add* as I have seen, plowers of mischief
and sowers of trouble will reap it.
By\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Or “From” \f* the breath of God they perish,
and by\f + \fr 4:9 \ft Or “from” \f* the blast of his anger they come to an end.
\add The\add* roar of \add the\add* lion and \add the\add* voice of a lion in its prime,
and \add the\add* teeth of \add the\add* young lions are broken.
\add The\add* lion is perishing without\f + \fr 4:11 \ft Or “from lack of” \f* prey,
and \add the\add* lion’s whelps are scattered.
“And a word came stealing to me,
and my ear received \add the\add* whisper from it.
Amid troubling thoughts from night visions,
at \add the\add* falling of deep sleep on men,
dread met me, and trembling,
and it made many of my bones shake.
And a spirit glided before my face;
the hair of my flesh\f + \fr 4:15 \ft Or “body” \f* bristled.
It stood still, but\f + \fr 4:16 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* I could not recognize its appearance;
a form \add was\add* ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 4:16 \ft Literally “to before” \f* my eyes;
\add there was\add* a hush, and I heard a voice:
‘Can a human being be more righteous than God,
or can a man be more pure than his Maker?
Look, he does not trust in his servants
and he charges his angels with error.
How much more dwellers in clay houses,
whose foundation \add is\add* in the dust?
They are crushed like a moth.
⸤Between morning and evening⸥\f + \fr 4:20 \ft Literally “from morning to the evening” \f* they are destroyed;
without \add anyone\add* regarding \add it\add* they perish forever.
\add Is\add* not their tent cord pulled up within them?
They die, but\f + \fr 4:21 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* not in\f + \fr 4:21 \ft Or “with” \f* wisdom.’
